task_description: Complete RTL and Internationalization implementation by migrating 24+ components from hardcoded strings to i18n system. Infrastructure (i18next, translations, LanguageToggle, RTL theme) already exists and works.

patterns.i18n_hook_pattern: Use const { t } = useTranslation() to access translations. Call t('namespace.key') to get translated strings.
patterns.translation_key_pattern: Translation files use nested structure: common.*, nav.*, dashboard.*, projects.*, etc. Keys match existing hardcoded text.
patterns.css_logical_properties: Replace marginLeft/Right with marginInlineStart/End, paddingLeft/Right with paddingInlineStart/End. Use text-align: start instead of text-align: left.
patterns.rtl_icon_flipping: Add className='flip-rtl' to directional icons (arrows, chevrons). DO NOT flip universal icons (settings, close, search).
patterns.mui_rtl_integration: Material-UI theme automatically receives direction from i18n via ThemeContext. No additional MUI configuration needed.

existing_implementations.description: i18n infrastructure is 100% complete. Config, translation files, LanguageToggle component, theme integration, and RTL CSS all exist and work.
relevant_files: src/i18n/config.ts - i18next configuration with language detection
src/hooks/useLanguage.ts - Custom hook for language switching and RTL detection
src/components/common/LanguageToggle.tsx - Language switcher component in Header
src/theme/ThemeContext.tsx - Integrates i18n direction into MUI theme
src/styles/rtl.css - RTL-specific CSS fixes (fonts, layout overrides, flip-rtl class)
src/main.tsx - Already imports i18n config and rtl.css
existing_implementations.what_works: Language switching works, theme direction changes, Hebrew font loads, RTL CSS applies. LanguageToggle component in Header allows switching between English and Hebrew.
existing_implementations.what_needs_work: 24+ components with hardcoded text need migration to use t() function. Many components use directional CSS (ml/mr) instead of logical properties (marginInlineStart/End). Comprehensive RTL testing needed.
